name: GCP Kubernetes Engine Clusters without any label information
description: This policy identifies all Kubernetes Engine Clusters which do not have labels. Having a cluster label helps you identify and categorize Kubernetes clusters.
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'gcp' AND api.name = 'gcloud-container-describe-clusters' AND json.rule = 'resourceLabels does not exist or resourceLabels.[*] is empty'
recommendation:
1. Login to GCP Portal
2. Go to Kubernetes Engine (Left Panel)
3. Select Kubernetes clusters 
4. From the list of clusters, choose the reported cluster
5. Click on 'SHOW INFO PANEL' button
6. Click on 'Add Label'
7. Specify customized data for Key and Value
8. Click on Save
compliance.standard: RBI Baseline Cyber Security and Resilience Requirements
